src:
“Človek je zelo majhen”
04 Nov 2019, 06:06 by Andraž Gombač

V Insuli se še do sobote z novimi slikami predstavlja Milan Erič, širši javnosti najbolj znan kot avtor prvega in še zmeraj edinega slovenskega celovečernega animiranega filma Socializacija bika? (1998), ki ga je ustvaril z Zvonkom Čohom.



Milan Erič se v galeriji Insula predstavlja s slikami, ustvarjenimi v zadnjih treh letih Foto: Andraž Gombač

IZOLA > Na razstavi V iskanju izgubljenega časa so zbrane slike, ustvarjene v zadnjih treh letih. “Začnejo se kot improvizacije, s polivanjem tuša, barve ustvarjam naključne oblike, ki jih potem skušam osmisliti z dodajanjem figur,” med sprehodom skozi razstavo pripoveduje akademski slikar Milan Erič, leta 1956 rojen v Slovenj Gradcu. “Zabavala me je tematika vesolja, prostranstva, igra ploskovitosti in volumna ... Čim se pojavi še figura, abstraktni prostor dobi nov pomen. Se pa lotevam še drugih tematik, tudi družbenoangažiranih.”
Dotaknila se ga je tudi problematika migrantov. “Hočeš nočeš to vstopi v delo. Na dnevnopolitične dogodke se odzivam z ironijo, grotesko,” pravi. Moč umetnosti vsekakor ni strašanska, a niti nična ni, je prepričan: “Pravijo, da umetnost ne more spreminjati sveta, vendar v mikrookolju vseeno vpliva na življenje, vsaj posameznikovo. Umetnost se kot skozi osmozo pritihotapi nekam zadaj v možgane. In morda postopoma vpliva tudi na družbo.”
Milan Eričslikar“Človek je majhen, še manjši, kakor ga slikam. V primerjavi z Zemljo je neznaten, v primerjavi z vesoljem pa je manjši od zrna peska v puščavi.”
Zanimivo je, da na njegovih slikah nastopajo ljudje, ki pa so vsi po vrsti zelo majhni. “Res je. Prvič, slikar ima tako manj dela s slikanjem,” se nasmehne. “In drugič, človek je majhen, še manjši, kakršnega slikam. V primerjavi z Zemljo je neznaten, v primerjavi z vesoljem pa je manjši od zrnca peska v puščavi.”
Pri Eriču je ključna linija, ugotavlja izolski gostitelj, umetnostni zgodovinar in likovni kritik Dejan Mehmedovič: “A tu imamo pred sabo še marsikaj, saj Erič rad prepleta vse mogoče. Že v temeljnem filmu Socializaciji bika? vidimo na delu dinamiko, stalno permutacijo figur, ki se spreminjajo, prehajajo druga v drugo.”
Že tretja letošnja nagrada za Milana EričaMilan Erič je letos že prejel najpomembnejši slovenski strokovni nagradi za ilustracijo in likovno umetnost, poimenovani po Hinku Smrekarju in Rihardu Jakopiču. Pred dnevi se jima je pridružila še ena - skupaj s kolegom Zvonkom Čohom je prejšnjo nedeljo v Slovenski kinoteki prejel nagrado Saša Dobrile za življenjsko delo na področju animiranega filma. Društvo slovenskega animiranega filma (DSAF) jima jo je namenilo za dolgoletno ustvarjanje in sorežijo celovečernega animiranega filma Socializacija bika? (na ilustraciji).Kot je v obrazložitvi zapisal član društva in dolgoletni programski direktor mednarodnega festivala animiranega filma Animateka Igor Prassel, edini slovenski celovečerni animirani film Socializacija bika? predstavlja “poseben in do danes edinstven prispevek k zgodovini slovenskega filma”. Čoh in Erič sta skoraj deset let v klasični tehniki risbe na papir animirala zgodbo, “ki jo je zapisalo življenje, zgodbo o zagnanosti, naivnosti, sebičnosti, maščevalnosti, lažeh, mleku, jušnih kockah in nenazadnje tudi o ljubezni”.Na prireditvi ob mednarodnem dnevu animiranega filma je DSAF tudi prvič podelil stanovske nagrade na področju animiranega filma. Dušan Kastelic je bil nagrajen za režijo projekta Celica (produkcija Bugbrain), Milanka Fabjančič za likovno podobo projekta Lilijana (produkcija ZVVIKS), Julia Peguet in Bartosz Kotarski pa za najboljšo tehniko animacije za projekt Koyaa - Izmuzljivi papir (produkcija ZVVIKS). Nagrajence so izbirali člani in članice društva.Nagrade in posebne omembe na področju študijskih projektov pa je izbrala komisija, ki so jo sestavljali Špela Čadež, Kolja Saksida in Zarja Menart. Nagrado za končani študijski animirani projekt za leto 2019 je prejela Sandra Jovanovska za kratki animirani film Soma, nagrado za študijski animirani projekt v razvoju pa Anja Resman za projekt Maska. AG, STA
Tudi slike na razstavi so barvite, igrive, duhovite, družbenokritične: truma do zob oboroženih vojakov lovi drobno begunko, skupina temnopoltih teka čez smučišče v mondenem St. Moritzu ...
Leta 2012 je Erič z Zvonkom Čohom gostoval v izolskem razstavišču Salsaverde. “V Izolo se rad vračam,” pravi. “Zelo mi je simpatično mesto, z vsemi tukajšnjimi akterji, geografsko lego, morjem ... Povabila sem bil vesel. Galerijo Insula poznam že od prej, nisem pa tu še nikoli razstavljal. Sem počaščen.”


Milan Erič se v galeriji Insula predstavlja s slikami, ustvarjenimi v zadnjih treh letih Foto: Andraž Gombač
text:
“Man is very small”
04 Nov 2019, 06:06 by Andraz Gombac

Until Saturday, new images are being introduced in Insula by Milan Erič, best known to the general public as the author of the first and still the only Slovenian feature animated film Socialization of the Bull? (1998), created by Zvonko Koh.



Milan Erič presents himself in the Insula Gallery with pictures created in the last three years Photo: Andraž Gombač

IZOLA> The exhibition In Search of the Lost Time, collects pictures created in the last three years. "They begin as improvisations, by pouring a shower, creating random shapes, which I then try to design by adding figures," says academic painter Milan Erič, born in Slovenj Gradec in 1956, as he walks through the exhibition. “I was entertained by the theme of space, vastness, the play of plot and volume ... As soon as a figure appears, abstract space takes on a new meaning. But I also address other topics, including the socially engaged. ”
He was also touched by the issue of migrants. "You don't want to get into work. I respond to daily political events with irony, grotesque, ”he says. The power of art is certainly not terrifying, but it is not null and void. As through osmosis, art smiles somewhere in the back of the brain. And it may also gradually affect society. ”
Milan Eričslikar “The man is small, even smaller than I am painting. It is insignificant in comparison to Earth and smaller in size than the grain of sand in the desert. "
Interestingly, his paintings feature people who are all very small in size. "It's true. First, the painter has less to do with painting, ”he smiles. "And second, the man is small, even smaller than I am. It is insignificant in comparison to Earth and smaller in size than the grain of sand in the desert. "
There is a key line with Eric, says the host of the Izola, art historian and art critic Dejan Mehmedovic: “But we still have a lot to do here, because Eric likes to interweave everything possible. Already in the seminal movie Socialization of the Bull? we see at work the dynamics, the constant permutation of the changing figures, they pass into each other. ”
Already the third Milan Eric Award this yearMilan Erič has already received the most important Slovenian professional award for illustration and fine arts, named after Hink Smrekar and Rihard Jakopič. A few days ago they were joined by another - together with his colleague Zvonko Čoh, he received the Saša Dobrile Award for his lifetime work in the field of animated film at the Slovenian Cinematheque last Sunday. The Slovenian Animated Film Society (DSAF) has dedicated them to the creation and co-creation of a feature-length animated film Socialization of the Bull? (illustrated) .As a member of the association and longtime program director of the Animateka International Animated Film Festival Igor Prassel, the only Slovenian feature-length animated film Socializing the Bull, wrote in the explanation. represents "a special and unique contribution to the history of Slovenian film to date." For almost ten years, Boh and Eric have been animating a classic paper-based animation of a story "written by life, a story of eagerness, naivety, selfishness, revenge, lies, milk, soup cubes and, last but not least, love." DSAF also presented animation awards for the first time on Animation Day. Dušan Kastelic was awarded for directing the Celica project (production of Bugbrain), Milanka Fabjančič for the artistic image of the Liliijana project (production of ZVVIKS), Julia Peguet and Bartosz Kotarski for the best animation technique for the project Koyaa - Plaster paper (production of ZVVIKS). The winners were selected by members and members of the Society. The awards and special mentions in the field of study projects were selected by a committee consisting of Špela Čadež, Kolja Saksida and Zarja Menart. The award for the completed student animation project for 2019 was awarded to Sandra Jovanovska for the short animated film Soma, and the award for the animated student animation project to Anja Resman for the Maska project. AG, STA
The paintings on the show are colorful, playful, witty, socially critical: the trumpet hunts a tiny refugee to the teeth of armed soldiers; Moritzu ...
In 2012, Eric toured with Zvonko Čoh at the Salsaverde Exhibition Center in Izola. "I like to return to Izola," he says. “I am a very nice city, with all the actors here, geographical location, sea ... I was pleased to invite. I have known the Insula Gallery before, but I have never exhibited here. I am honored. "


Milan Erič presents himself in the Insula Gallery with pictures created in the last three years Photo: Andraž Gombač
